required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Left Atrial Appendage Closure With the LAmbre
clinical_study.official_title: Percutaneous Left Atrial Appendage Closure Using the LAmbre Device in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation: a Single-center, Retrospective, Long-term Real-world Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study was to retrospectively analyse the efficacy and safety of LAA closure using the LAmbre in our center from April 2014 to November 2015.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was to retrospectively analyse the efficacy and safety of percutaneous left atrial appendage (LAA) closure using the LAmbre (Lifetech Scientific Co., Ltd., Shenzhen, China) in our center from April 2014 to November 2015. 89.4% has finished the 12-month esophageal ecllocardiogrhy (TEE) examination. The average followup was 2-years.

secondary_outcome.measure: The composite safety and efficacy end-points
secondary_outcome.description: all-cause death, stroke, major bleeding, thromboembolism, device related severe complications
successful sealing around the device at the LAA orifice (residual jet flow of < 5 mm) as measured by transesophageal echocardiogram (TEE) at 6 months after device implantation

arm_group.description: The patients with atrial fibrillation who received left atrial appendage (LAA) closure using the LAmbre device in our center from April 2014 to November 2015.

intervention.description: Percutaneous Left Atrial Appendage Closure Using the LAmbre Device in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

study_pop.textblock: The aim of this retrospective study was to evaluate the long-term follow-up results associated with left atrial appendage closure (LAAC) with the LAmbre (Lifetech Scientific Corp., Shenzhen, China) in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF).

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Head of Cardiology, Principal Investigator
